the difficulty that we at KUQH had in ordering discs, listed
in the catalogue, which we learned were out of stock. He
replied that they do not consider their service as the counter¬
part of a commercial music record library, and that they could
not afford to stock additional copies of all the programs in
the catalogue. However, they are trying to carry extras of
some items apt to be in considerable and extended demand.
I was particularly interested in reviewing BBC-BFA rela¬
tionships. Apparently BFA had proposed becoming the USA
distribution medium for BBC programs, but this offer the BBC
has rejected. Frost pointed out that they do not even deal
thru their own New York office, preferring to service the USA
(and the rest of the world, for that matter) direct from London,
so why should they appoint BFA as their American representative.
They had done a few special shows for BFA (for example, for BFAfs
Cities of the World series), but these were the exceptions, not
the rule.
Frost declared himself strongly pro-NAEB, and is surely
aware of BFA's expanding tendencies. I should be much surprised
if BFA got many special favors out of BBC, even though Basil
Thornton is with them.
Incidentally, Barry Thorne is back in England. I havenft
seen him yet, but intend to invite Barry and Barbara out to
see us before we leave. The new man, Derek Hussell, and I
have a luncheon date for next week, and I shall try to brief
him as to the facts of educational broadcasting in America*
I asked Frost what he knew of BFA deals with Bayreuth and/or
Salzburg. He didn't know of any, but said he would check in
his files and let me know. X have exchanged letters with the
Germans and Austrians about these festivals, and shall do my
darndest to get some good tapes for NAEB. If their rules pro¬
hibit mass duplication, lfll try for rights on a few of our
principal stations.
Thank you Harry for your kind words. Let me assure you,
I greatly appreciate the many services you've performed for me
while I have been over here!
With best personal regards,
Yours sincerely
Burton Paulu
